commitResults.messageTitle: Rename Duke.java to Green.java, add level-0 into Green.java
Add ability to store input text, display them when requested
Add Task.java, add marking and unmarking ability
Tweak code to comply with coding standard
Modify Green.java, Task.java, add ToDo.java, Deadline.java, Event.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Modify and add said files to support tracking 3 types of tasks.
Use inheritance to support the 3 task types extending from Task:
*ToDO
*Deadline
*Event

isInList() method in Green.java traverses through the current list of
tasks and checks if the description of the task being passed in is the
same as that in the list. With the addition of new task types with more
attributes other than a description, the isInList() method can
become verbose when checking equality of multiple attributes for
multiple task types.

Overriding the equals() method in Task.java, ToDo.java, Deadline.java
and Event.java allows isInList() method to use polymorphism to be able
target the superclass Task so that it works with its subclass objects
ToDo, Deadline and Event. In that case, for every iteration, a single
equality check that targets the superclass Task suffices.

Let's override the equals() method in Task.java, ToDo.java,
Deadline.java and Event.java to use polymorphism in the isInList()
method.

Using polymorphism allows the isInList() method to be simpler and more
flexible, because the isInList() method works even when more task types
are added.

User input contains more details due to the addition of new task types.
This increases the code length on user input in the main method in
Green.java.

Extracting the code on user input into separate methods allows code to
be written at a higher level of abstraction.

Let's extract the code on user input into new methods parseCommand()
and parseInput().

Code written at higher level of abstraction adds to readability and
maintainability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify input.txt, EXPECTED.TXT, and runtest.bat to semi-automate text UI testing
Modify Green.java and EXPECTED.TXT to improve code readability
commitResults.messageBody:
Restructure conditional statements in addTask() method using guard
clauses to make the happy path prominent.

Simplify complicated expression of if condition in the main method that
checks if user input is missing a required task entry by calculating
intermediate boolean values and checking for the final value in
isMissingTask.

Make other tweaks such as renaming variables with explicit names,
removing redundant code, and using blank lines to separate groups of
related code.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add exception handling in Green.java to handle NumberFormatException in user input
commitResults.messageBody:
Handle NumberFormatException when user inputs something other than a
list number for marking/unmarking task. Let the user know that a number
should be entered when entering 'mark' or 'unmark'.

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify Green.java to add exception handling for IllegalArgumentException and ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
commitResults.messageBody:
User may enter empty or unknown requests, or requests with missing task
entries or timings.

Throw and handle IllegalArgumentException for empty or unknown
requests, and throw and handle ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException for
requests that are missing required task or timing entries.
